<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/17/unvaccinated-people-increasingly-target-of-financial-penalties?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Being unvaccinated is getting expensive
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/17/unvaccinated-people-increasingly-target-of-financial-penalties?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Novak Djokovic hangs his head at the net " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b2358ff2e10176449af0eebec2509b468469d9e6-4946x3294.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Naomi Baker/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some people who remain unvaxed against Covid-19 are going to have to budget that decision in along with groceries, car insurance, and the heating bill.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Look no further than Novak Djokovic, whose career is on the verge of being derailed because he is unvaccinated. The tennis star left potential winnings of $3.3 million on the table when he was blocked from playing in the Australian Open due to his vaccination status. But that’s just the beginning of his professional concerns:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s not clear how Djok can play in the French Open, the next Grand Slam tournament on the schedule, since the country just </span><span><a href="https://sports.yahoo.com/novak-djokovic-cant-play-at-french-open-unless-vaccinated-french-sports-ministry-says-183956146.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed a new law</a></span><span> that requires proof of vaccination for anyone at venues like sports arenas and restaurants. The UK and the US, which are hosting the final two majors of the year (Wimbledon and the US Open), also have tough restrictions on unvaccinated people.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lacoste, the apparel brand that sponsors Djokovic, said it would “review the events” surrounding his rejection by Australia. Djokovic is the 46th highest-paid athlete in the world, bringing in roughly $30 million in endorsements a year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But tennis star or otherwise, unvaccinated people around the world are increasingly being hit by financial penalties as governments try to boost lagging vax rates. A quick roundup...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Greece: </strong>Beginning Sunday, unvaccinated people in Greece aged 60 and over will have to <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2022/01/17/1073623759/in-greece-unvaccinated-people-ages-60-and-up-now-face-monthly-fines?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pay a monthly fine</a> of €50 ($57), a penalty that’ll be doubled in February. “It’s the price to pay for health,” Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Austria:</strong> The government is planning to slap all unvaccinated adults with fines of <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-16/austria-to-start-fines-for-unvaccinated-in-march-nehammer-says?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up to $4,108</a> beginning in mid-March.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Canada: </strong>The Quebec government announced last week that unvaccinated adults will soon have to <a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/01/11/1072245389/quebec-unvaccinated-covid-penalty?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pay a financial penalty</a>. Quebec’s premier said the policy was a “question of fairness” for the 90% of Quebec adults who are vaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The US:</strong> President Biden’s vax-or-test mandate for large employers, which could have led to fines up to $136,000, was struck down by the Supreme Court last week. Still, a number of corporations have implemented some form of “no-vax tax” on employees anyway: Delta is charging unvaccinated staff on its health plan an extra $200/month, and Kroger eliminated paid leave for unvaxed employees who get Covid.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/chinas-birth-rate-drops-for-fifth-straight-year?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
The Chinese government wants grandchildren
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/chinas-birth-rate-drops-for-fifth-straight-year?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Daycare in Suzhou, Jiangsu, China" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/57d2a5a889df1717653b0e1334a81aab3078346d-4312x2959.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Jerry Wang/Unsplash</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China has so many unworn baby shoes that Ernest Hemingway would be shook. The country <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/17/economy/china-population-data-2021-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed</a> that its birth rate dropped for a fifth straight year in 2021, and its population growth fell to a 61-year low.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This drop was even worse than some demographers' lowest estimates. With the share of working-age people (16–59) falling from 70.1% a decade ago to 62.5% last year, the government is getting worried that its aging population could hinder economic growth and significantly outnumber younger workers who support older citizens. In response, officials have taken steps to encourage its citizens to make more babies, including…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lifting the disastrous “one-child rule” in 2016 to allow families to have two children, and then allowing up to three children per family last year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Limiting and even </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/09/china-bans-private-tutors-from-giving-online-classes.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banning</a></span><span> for-profit tutoring in order to reduce the cost of child-rearing. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Some experts think the Chinese population may have hit a peak. “The year 2021 will go down in Chinese history as the year that China last saw population growth in its long history,” Wang Feng, a professor of sociology at the University of California, Irvine, told the NYT.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/17/the-paycheck-protection-timely-but-highly-regressive-researchers-say?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Some lessons from PPP
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/17/the-paycheck-protection-timely-but-highly-regressive-researchers-say?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Man at stack of cash saying "Here's money! Go!"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-26/image-ab2e1bbca110cd56f0e0f56d5a7729868192a9f0-480x270-gif/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Man at stack of cash saying " Here's money! Go!"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-26/image-ab2e1bbca110cd56f0e0f56d5a7729868192a9f0-480x270-gif/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>NBC</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An All-Star team of economists just dropped a <a href="https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w29669/w29669.pdf?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paper</a> analyzing the performance of the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP), the massive government relief package that aimed to help small businesses keep workers on payroll during the onset of Covid-19.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, how’d it go? Like a Peter Jackson director’s cut, it had some quality content but also a lot of fluff.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pros:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Timeliness: </strong></span><span>PPP delivered a “staggering sum of money over a 2-month period in the spring 2020,” when American workers needed it most.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Scale: </strong></span><span>93% of small businesses in the US received at least one PPP loan. In size, PPP was roughly equivalent to the entire recovery package from the 2007–2009 financial crisis.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The big con:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">It was “highly regressive,” </strong></span><span>meaning that people who may not have needed the cash got the majority of it. About three-fourths of PPP funds went to the top quintile of households, and only 23%–34% of PPP funds went directly to workers who would have lost their jobs otherwise.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Other wealthy countries with existing worker support systems were able to better target their relief programs than the unprepared US was. Instead, the authors wrote, the US “chose to administer emergency aid using a fire hose rather than a fire extinguisher.”—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/17/the-paycheck-protection-timely-but-highly-regressive-researchers-say&utm_source=facebook_share" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=PPP%20was%20roughly%20equivalent%20in%20size%20to%20the%20entire%20recovery%20package%20from%20the%202007%E2%80%932009%20financial%20crisis.&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/17/the-paycheck-protection-timely-but-highly-regressive-researchers-say&utm_source=twitter_share&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>That, friends, is what is purported to be the <a href="https://www.upi.com/Odd_News/2022/01/14/worlds-largest-cast-iron-skillet-Tennessee-highway/8331642191385/?utm_source=join1440&utm_medium=email&utm_placement=newsletter" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">world’s largest cast-iron skillet</a>, measuring about 18 feet across and weighing 14,360 pounds. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Nobody cares about what’s happening to the Uyghurs.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chamath Palihapitiya, the billionaire investor and partial owner of the Golden State Warriors, is getting criticized after he said on a podcast that the genocide of the Uyghur minority in China <a href="https://nypost.com/2022/01/17/warriors-chamath-palihapitiya-no-one-cares-about-uyghurs/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">isn’t something he is worried</a> about right now. CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/spice-dao-jodorowsky-dune-adaptation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
That's too many spices
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/spice-dao-jodorowsky-dune-adaptation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="That's too many spices" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=278 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-17/image-056bdef81d3b540e0c56fcead34ed3b7e7251c94-480x199-gif/giphy-1.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="That's too many spices" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-17/image-056bdef81d3b540e0c56fcead34ed3b7e7251c94-480x199-gif/giphy-1.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Warner Bros.</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Frank Herbert wrote in <em>Dune</em>, “The real universe is always one step beyond logic.” Case in point: a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/e83fe16f-fb28-4795-919e-4f1d314e6794?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent $3 million</a> on a rare copy of a proposed <em>Dune </em>adaptation, allegedly with the misguided idea that owning the book would also grant them the rights to its content.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some background: </strong>In 1974, director Alejandro Jodorowsky printed 20 copies of an exhaustive book that contained the script and concept art for his 14-hour film adaptation of Herbert’s <em>Dune</em>. This film was ultimately scrapped, due to its budget, but the book became the stuff of legend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fast forward to November 2021 and Spice DAO, a blockchain collective, bought a copy of the book at auction for €2.66 million (~$3 million USD, around 100x its expected price). On Sunday, the DAO tweeted that they intended to do three things with the book:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Make it public</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Produce an animated series based on it</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Support community projects</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An inspiring plan, with a few major roadblocks: 1) Spice DAO only purchased the <em>book</em>, not the rights to its content, which would be needed to create an animated series. 2) The book is already public, and available to browse on <a href="https://photos.app.goo.gl/qwvbmNME6WRTce1b7?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google Photos</a>.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBeing unvaccinated is getting expensive \n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Novak Djokovic hangs his head at the net \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNaomi Baker/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome people who remain unvaxed against Covid-19 are going to have to budget that decision in along with groceries, car insurance, and the heating bill.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLook no further than Novak Djokovic, whose career is on the verge of being derailed because he is unvaccinated. The tennis star left potential winnings of $3.3 million on the table when he was blocked from playing in the Australian Open due to his vaccination status. But that’s just the beginning of his professional concerns:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt’s not clear how Djok can play in the French Open, the next Grand Slam tournament on the schedule, since the country just \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://sports.yahoo.com/novak-djokovic-cant-play-at-french-open-unless-vaccinated-french-sports-ministry-says-183956146.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed a new law\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that requires proof of vaccination for anyone at venues like sports arenas and restaurants. The UK and the US, which are hosting the final two majors of the year (Wimbledon and the US Open), also have tough restrictions on unvaccinated people.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLacoste, the apparel brand that sponsors Djokovic, said it would “review the events” surrounding his rejection by Australia. Djokovic is the 46th highest-paid athlete in the world, bringing in roughly $30 million in endorsements a year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut tennis star or otherwise, unvaccinated people around the world are increasingly being hit by financial penalties as governments try to boost lagging vax rates. A quick roundup...\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGreece: \u003c/strong\u003eBeginning Sunday, unvaccinated people in Greece aged 60 and over will have to \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2022/01/17/1073623759/in-greece-unvaccinated-people-ages-60-and-up-now-face-monthly-fines?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epay a monthly fine\u003c/a\u003e of €50 ($57), a penalty that’ll be doubled in February. “It’s the price to pay for health,” Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAustria:\u003c/strong\u003e The government is planning to slap all unvaccinated adults with fines of \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-16/austria-to-start-fines-for-unvaccinated-in-march-nehammer-says?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup to $4,108\u003c/a\u003e beginning in mid-March.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCanada: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Quebec government announced last week that unvaccinated adults will soon have to \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2022/01/11/1072245389/quebec-unvaccinated-covid-penalty?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epay a financial penalty\u003c/a\u003e. Quebec’s premier said the policy was a “question of fairness” for the 90% of Quebec adults who are vaccinated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe US:\u003c/strong\u003e President Biden’s vax-or-test mandate for large employers, which could have led to fines up to $136,000, was struck down by the Supreme Court last week. Still, a number of corporations have implemented some form of “no-vax tax” on employees anyway: Delta is charging unvaccinated staff on its health plan an extra $200/month, and Kroger eliminated paid leave for unvaxed employees who get Covid.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" With the share of working-age people (16–59) falling from 70.1% a decade ago to 62.5% last year, the government is getting worried that its aging population could hinder economic growth and significantly outnumber younger workers who support older citizens. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLifting the disastrous “one-child rule” in 2016 to allow families to have two children, and then allowing up to three children per Like a Peter Jackson director’s cut, it had some quality content but also a lot of fluff.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pros:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTimeliness: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePPP delivered a “staggering sum of money over a 2-month period in the spring 2020,” when American workers needed it most.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eScale: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e93% of small businesses in the US received at least one PPP loan. In size, PPP was roughly equivalent to the entire recovery package from the 2007–2009 financial crisis.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe big con:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt was “highly regressive,” \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003emeaning that people who may not have needed the cash got the majority of it. About three-fourths of PPP funds went to the top quintile of households, and only 23%–34% of PPP funds went directly to workers who would have lost their jobs otherwise.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eOther wealthy countries with existing worker support systems were able to better target their relief programs than the unprepared US was. Instead, the authors wrote, the US “chose to administer emergency aid using a fire hose rather than a fire extinguisher.”—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003cem\u003eDune\u003c/em\u003e, “The real universe is always one step beyond logic.” Case in point: a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/e83fe16f-fb28-4795-919e-4f1d314e6794?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espent $3 million\u003c/a\u003e on a rare copy of a proposed \u003cem\u003eDune \u003c/em\u003eadaptation, allegedly with the misguided idea that owning the book would also grant them the rights to its content.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome background: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 1974, director Alejandro Jodorowsky printed 20 copies of an exhaustive book that contained the script and concept art for his 14-hour film adaptation of Herbert’s \u003cem\u003eDune\u003c/em\u003e. This film was ultimately scrapped, due to its budget, but the book became the stuff of legend.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFast forward to November 2021 and Spice DAO, a blockchain collective, bought a copy of the book at auction for €2.66 million (~$3 million USD, around 100x its expected price). On Sunday, the DAO tweeted that they intended to do three things with the book:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMake it public\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eProduce an animated series based on it\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSupport community projects\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn inspiring plan, with a few major roadblocks: 1) Spice DAO only purchased the \u003cem\u003ebook\u003c/em\u003e, not the rights to its content, which would be needed to create an animated series. 2) The book is already public, and available to browse on \u003ca href=\"https://photos.app.goo.gl/qwvbmNME6WRTce1b7?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid
